article.paragraph: Aaliyah Dana Haughton(IPAc-ena:.ˈliː.ə) (January 16, 1979  August 25, 2001) was an American singer, dancer, actress, and model. She was born inBrooklyn, New York, and raised inDetroit, Michigan. At the age of 10, she appeared on the television showStar Searchand performed in concert alongsideGladys Knight. At age 12, Aaliyah signed withJive Recordsand her uncleBarry Hankerson'sBlackground Records. Hankerson introduced her toR. Kelly, who became her mentor, as well as lead songwriter and producer of her debut album,Age Ain't Nothing but a Number. The album sold three million copies in the United States and was certified double platinum by theRecording Industry Association of America(RIAA). After facing allegations of an illegal marriage withR. Kelly, Aaliyah ended her contract with Jive and signed withAtlantic Records.

Aaliyah worked with record producersTimbalandandMissy Elliottfor her second album,One in a Million (Aaliyah album)One in a Million; it sold 3.7 million copies in the United States and over eight million copies worldwide. In 2000, Aaliyah appeared in her first film,Romeo Must Die. She contributed to the film's soundtrack, which spawned the single "Try Again (Aaliyah song)Try Again". The song topped theBillboard Hot 100''Billboard'' Hot 100solely onairplay, making Aaliyah the first artist inBillboard (magazine)Billboardhistory to achieve this goal. "Try Again" earned Aaliyah aGrammy Awardnomination for Best Female R&B Vocalist. After completingRomeo Must Die, Aaliyah filmed her role inQueen of the Damned (film)Queen of the Damned. She released her third and final album,Aaliyah (album)Aaliyah, in July 2001.

On August 25, 2001, Aaliyah and eight others were killed in a plane crash in theBahamasafter filming the music video for the single "Rock the Boat (Aaliyah song)Rock the Boat". Theaviatorpilot, Luis Morales III, was unlicensed at the time of the accident and had traces ofcocaineand alcohol in his system. Aaliyah's family later filed awrongful death claimwrongful deathlawsuit againstBlackhawk International Airways, which was settled out of court. Aaliyah's music has continued to achieve commercial success with several posthumous releases. Aaliyah sold 32 million albums worldwide. She has been credited for helping redefinecontemporary R&B,pop musicpopandhip hop musichip hop,http://www.rollingstone.com/tv/features/10-craziest-things-we-learned-from-the-aaliyah-lifetime-movie-20141117earning her theHonorific nicknames in popular musicnicknames"Princess of R&B" and "Queen of Urban Pop". She is listed byBillboardas the tenth most successful female R&B artist of the past 25 years and 27th most successful R&B artist in history.
article.heading: Early life
article.paragraph: Aaliyah Dana Haughton was born on January 16, 1979, inBrooklyn, New York,cite web{{Allmusic|classAaliyah BiographyHueySteve[[AllMusic]]November 8, 2008and was the younger child of Diane and Michael Haughton.She wasAfrican American, and was said to haveOneida peopleOneidaheritage from a grandmother.harvnbSutherland20051nonecite newshttp://archives.cnn.com/2001/COMMUNITY/08/27/welbekin.cnna/index.htmlVibe Magazine's Emil Wilbekin: Remembering AaliyahAugust 27, 2001CNNMay 6, 2009https://web.archive.org/web/20090616164855/http://archives.cnn.com/2001/COMMUNITY/08/27/welbekin.cnna/index.htmlJune 16, 2009noHer name has been described as a female version of theArabic languageArabic"Ali"; however, the original Arabic and Jewish name "Aliya (disambiguation)Aliya(Hebrew: )" derived from theHebrew languageHebrewword "Aliyah (disambiguation)aliyah(Hebrew: )", and meant "highest, most exalted one, the best."cite webhttp://baby-names.allparenting.com/list/Hebrew_Baby_Names/Aaliyah/details/Meaning of Aaliyah – baby name Aaliyahallparenting.comRegardless of origin, the singer was highly fond of her Semitic name, expressing support by calling it "beautiful" and asserting that she was "very proud of it," and she thus spent her entire life striving to live up to her name every day.At a young age, Aaliyah was enrolled in voice lessons by her mother.She started performing at weddings, churchchoirand charity events.harvnbSutherland20059SutherlandWhen she was five years old, her family moved toDetroit, Michigan, where she was raised along with her older brother,Rashad HaughtonRashad.harvnbKenyatta20023Kenyattacite bookBogdanovVladimirWoodstra, Chris; Erlewine, Stephen ThomasAll Music Guide to Rock[[Hal Leonard Corporation]]200210-87930-653-XShe attended aCatholic ChurchCatholicschool, Gesu Elementary, where infirst grade, she received a part in the stage playAnnie (musical)Annie. From then on, she was determined to become an entertainer.In Detroit, her father began working in the warehouse business, one of his brother-in-lawBarry Hankerson's widening interests. Her mother stayed home and raised Aaliyah and her brother.cite bookJenniferWarnerAaliyah: A Biographyhttps://books.google.com/books?id2014BookCap Study Guides

Throughout her life, she had a good relationship with her brother, which traced back to their childhood as Rashad reflected that growing up with Aaliyah was "amazing". He recalled her running around their home singing and that never being annoying due to her having a "beautiful voice". She and her brother became close with their cousin Jomo Hankerson, since growing up, they lived "about five blocks apart". Jomo walked Aaliyah and Rashad to their home from school when their mother was not able to pick them up and recalled the Haughton household being filled with music.Farley 2002, pp. 2223.Aaliyah's family was very close due to the struggles of her grandparents and when the Haughtons moved to Detroit, the Hankersons were ready to take them in if necessary. These same bonds led to ties in the music industry, under the Blackground Records label.

Aaliyah's mother was a vocalist, and her uncle,Barry Hankerson, was anentertainment lawyerwho had been married toGladys Knight.As a child, Aaliyah traveled with Knight and worked with an agent in New York to audition for commercials and television programs, includingFamily Matters; she went on to appear onStar Searchat the age of ten.Aaliyah chose to begin auditioning while her mother made the decision to have her surname dropped.harvnbSutherland200515noneShe auditioned for several record labels and at age 11 appeared in concerts alongside Knight.cite newshttp://www.independent.co.uk/news/obituaries/aaliyah-755377.htmlAaliyah – Obituaries, NewsPerronePierreAugust 27, 2001[[The Independent]]April 4, 2009Londonhttps://web.archive.org/web/20100606064412/http://www.independent.co.uk/news/obituaries/aaliyah-755377.htmlJune 6, 2010She had several pet animals in during her childhood, which included ducks, snakes and iguanas. Her cousin Jomo had a pet alligator, which Aaliyah felt was too much, remarking, "that was something I wasn't going to stroke."

Her grandmother died in 1991. Years after her death, Aaliyah said her grandmother supported everyone in the family and always wanted to hear her sing, as well as admitting that she "spoiled" her and her brother Rashad "to death." She also enjoyed Aaliyah's singing and would have Aaliyah to sing for her. Aaliyah stated that she thought of her grandmother whenever she fell into depression.cite webhttp://2.bp.blogspot.com/-c5NSZQguXKI/UrISESr2cSI/AAAAAAAABdM/yAzUy9B0moU/s1600/tumblr_mxyel4e9l31sck243o4_1280.jpgPhotograph of interviewblogspot.com2014-07-29Aaliyah's hands reminded her of her aunt, who died when she was "very young" and Aaliyah referred to her as an "amazingly beautiful woman".cite newshttp://www.nydailynews.com/archives/news/humor-sweets-delights-article-1.927110HUMOR & SWEETS WERE HER DELIGHTSLaurenRubinAugust 28, 2001The New York Times
article.heading: Education
article.paragraph: Aaliyah attended Detroit schools growing up and believed she was well-liked, but got teased for her short stature. She recalled coming into her own prior to age 15 and grew to love her height. Her mother would tell her to be happy that she was small and compliment her. Other children disliked Aaliyah, but she did not stay focused on them. "You always have to deal with people who are jealous, but there were so few it didn't even matter. The majority of kids supported me, which was wonderful. When it comes to dealing with negative people, I just let it in one ear and out the other. Those people were invisible to me." Even in her adult life, she considered herself small. She had "learned to accept and love" herself and added: "... the most important thing is to think highly of yourself because if you don't, no one else will".Sutherland 2005, 24.

Aaliyah, who maintained a perfect 4.0 grade point average when graduating from Detroit High School for the Fine and Performing Arts, felt education was important. She saw fit to keep her grades up despite the pressures and time constraints brought on her during the early parts of her career. She labeled herself as a perfectionist and recalled always being a good student. Aaliyah reflected: "I always wanted to maintain that, even in high school when I first started to travel. I wanted to keep that 4.0. Being in the industry, you know, I don't want kids to think, 'I can just sing and forget about school.' I think it's very important to have an education, and even more important to have something to fall back on." She did this in her own life, as she planned to "fall back on" another part of the entertainment industry. She believed that if she could teach music history or open her own school to teach that or drama if she did not not make a living as a recording artist because, as she reasoned, "when you pick a career it has to be something you love".

Age Ain't Nothing But a Numberreceived generally favorable reviews from music critics. Some writers noted that Aaliyah's "silky vocals" and "sultry voice" blended with Kelly'snew jack swinghelped definecontemporary R&BR&Bin the 1990s.cite newshttp://www.ew.com/ew/article/0,,302670,00.htmlAge Ain't Nothing But a Number – Music ReviewEhrlichDimitriJune 17, 1994[[Entertainment Weekly]]May 17, 2009https://web.archive.org/web/20090421095311/http://www.ew.com/ew/article/0,,302670,00.htmlApril 21, 2009nocite webhttp://www.slantmagazine.com/music/music_review.asp?IDAaliyah: Age Ain't Nothing But a NumberCinquemaniSal2001[[Slant Magazine|Slant]]May 17, 2009https://web.archive.org/web/20090509225004/http://www.slantmagazine.com/music/music_review.asp?IDMay 9, 2009noHer sound was also compared to that of female quartetEn Vogue.harvnbBrackettHoard20041noneChristopher John Farley ofTime (magazine)Timemagazine described the album as a "beautifully restrained work", noting that Aaliyah's "girlish, breathy vocals rode calmly on R. Kelly's rough beats".cite newshttp://www.time.com/time/arts/article/0,8599,172511,00.htmlSiren of SubtletyFarleyChristopher JohnAugust 26, 2001TimeSeptember 14, 2009Stephen Thomas ErlewineofAllMusicfelt that the album had its "share of filler", but described the singles as "slyly seductive".He also claimed that the songs on the album were "frequently better" than that of Kelly's second studio album,12 Play.The single "At Your Best (You Are Love)" was criticized byBillboardfor being out of place on the album and for its length.
article.heading: 199699:One in a Million
article.paragraph: ListenAaliyah - If Your Girl Only Knew sample.ogg"If Your Girl Only Knew" (1996)The first single released from her second studio album, "[[If Your Girl Only Knew]]" was described as a sassy, organ-infused song.<ref name[[Ogg]]rightIn 1996, Aaliyah leftJive Recordsand signed withAtlantic Records.She worked with record producersTimbalandandMissy Elliott, who contributed to her second studio album,One in a Million (Aaliyah album)One in a Million.Missy Elliott recalled Timbaland and herself being nervous to work with Aaliyah, since Aaliyah had already released her successful dbut album while Missy Elliott and Timbaland were just starting out. Missy Elliott also feared she would be a diva, but reflected that Aaliyah "came in and was so warming; she made us immediately feel like family."The album yielded the single "If Your Girl Only Knew", which topped theBillboard (magazine)BillboardHot R&B/Hip-Hop Songsfor two weeks.It also generated the singles "Hot Like Fire" and "4 Page Letter". The following year, Aaliyah was featured onTimbaland & Magoo's debut single, "Up Jumps da Boogie".cite journalSeptember 10, 2001Singer Aaliyah, Eight Others Die in Plane Crash in Bahamas[[Jet (magazine)|Jet]]560021-5996https://books.google.com/?idJune 21, 2009One in a Millionpeaked at number 18 on theBillboard 200''Billboard'' 200,selling over 3.7 million copies in the United States and over eight million copies worldwide.cite newshttp://musica.univision.com/fotos/slideshow/2010-08-25/aaliyah-a-nueve-anos-de-su-muerteAaliyah:August 25, 2010[[Univision]]September 17, 2010https://web.archive.org/web/20101028111304/http://musica.univision.com/fotos/slideshow/2010-08-25/aaliyah-a-nueve-anos-de-su-muerteOctober 28, 2010noharvnbSimmonds2008454SimmondsThe album was certifiedRecording Industry Association of Americadouble platinumby the RIAA on June 16, 1997, denoting shipments of two million copies.The month prior toOne in a Million's release, on May 5, 1997, music publisher Windswept Pacific filed a lawsuit in U.S. District Court against Aaliyah claiming she had illegally copiedBobby Caldwell's "What You Won't Do for Love (song)What You Won't Do for Love" for the single "Age Ain't Nothing but a Number (song)Age Ain't Nothing but a Number".cite newshttp://www.mtv.com/news/1424665/aaliyah-r-kelly-named-in-copyright-lawsuit/May 7, 1997Aaliyah, R. Kelly Named In Copyright LawsuitMTV

article.heading: 2000:Romeo Must Die
article.paragraph: In 1999, Aaliyah landed her first movie role inRomeo Must Die, released March 22, 2000. Aaliyah starred opposite martial artistJet Li, playing a couple who fall in love amid their warring families. It grossed US$18.6 million in its first weekend, ranking number two at the box office.cite newshttp://www.ew.com/ew/article/0,,85088,00.html'Romeo' and JuliaWolkJoshMarch 26, 2000[[Entertainment Weekly]]May 10, 2009Aaliyah purposely stayed away from reviews of the film to "make it easier on" herself, but she heard "that people were able to get into me, which is what I wanted."cite newshttp://articles.orlandosentinel.com/2001-07-22/news/0107220074_1_aaliyah-barbra-streisand-jennifer-lopezHip-pop's Aaliyah Flaunts VersatilityJuly 22, 2001Orlando SentinelIn contrast, some critics felt there was no chemistry between her and Jet Li, as well as viewing the film was too simplistic.This was echoed by Elvis Mitchell ofThe New York Times, who wrote that while Aaliyah was "a natural" and the film was conceived as a spotlight for both her and Li, "they have so little chemistry together you'd think they're putting out a fire instead of shooting off sparks.cite newsThe New York Timeshttp://www.nytimes.com/movie/review?resElvisMitchellRomeo Must Die (2000) FILM REVIEW; Hip-Hop Joins Martial Arts but Lets Plot Muscle InMarch 22, 2000Her role was well received by Glen Oliver byIGNwho liked that she did not portray her character "as a victimized female" but instead "as a strong female who does not come across as an over-the-top Women's Right Advocate."cite newshttp://www.ign.com/articles/2000/02/10/review-of-romeo-must-dieReview of Romeo Must DieIGNFebruary 10, 2000GlenOliver

In addition to acting, Aaliyah served as an executive producer of theRomeo Must Die (soundtrack)film's soundtrack, where she contributed four songs.cite newshttp://www.nytimes.com/2001/08/27/arts/aaliyah-22-singer-who-first-hit-the-charts-at-14.htmlAaliyah, 22, Singer Who First Hit the Charts at 14ParelesJonAugust 27, 2001[[The New York Times]]May 10, 2009"Try Again (Aaliyah song)Try Again" was released as a single from the soundtrack; the song topped theBillboard Hot 100''Billboard'' Hot 100, making Aaliyah the first artist to top the chart based solely onairplay; this led the song to be released in a12-inch single12" vinylandgramophone record7" single.cite bookBronsonFredThe Billboard Book of Number 1 HitsBillboard Books20038960-8230-7677-6The music video won theMTV Video Music Award for Best Female VideoBest Female VideoandMTV Video Music Award for Best Video from a FilmBest Video from a Filmawards at the2000 MTV Video Music Awards.cite newshttp://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/entertainment/915759.stmMTV Video Music Awards: The winnersSeptember 8, 2000BBC NewsMay 21, 2009LondonIt also earned her aGrammy Awardnomination for Best Female R&B Vocalist.cite newshttp://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/americas/1510034.stmR&B's Aaliyah dies in plane crashAugust 26, 2001BBC NewsMay 21, 2009Londonhttps://web.archive.org/web/20090623203342/http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/americas/1510034.stmJune 23, 2009noThe soundtrack went on to sell 1.5 million copies in the United States.cite webhttp://www.billboard.com/articles/news/79059/aaliyah-returns-to-musicAaliyah Returns to MusicHallRashaunJuly 20, 2001BillboardJuly 23, 2009https://web.archive.org/web/20090802031044/http://www.billboard.com/August 2, 2009no
article.heading: 2001:Aaliyah
article.paragraph: After completingRomeo Must Die, Aaliyah began to work on her second film,Queen of the Damned (film)Queen of the Damned. She played the role of an ancientvampire, Queen Akasha, which she described as a "manipulative, crazy, sexual being".Prior to her death, she expressed the possibility of recording songs for the film's soundtrack and welcomed the possibility of collaborating withJonathan Davis.She was scheduled to film for the sequels ofThe Matrixas the characterZee (The Matrix)Zee.cite webhttp://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1453366/20020411/gaye_nona.jhtmlAaliyah's 'Matrix' Role to Be Given to Nona GayeGoodmanAbbeyApril 11, 2002[[MTV News]]April 14, 2009https://web.archive.org/web/20090331112845/http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1453366/20020411/gaye_nona.jhtmlMarch 31, 2009no

In May 2001,Shaquille O'Nealadmitted that his remarks where he claimed to have engaged in sexual intercourse with Aaliyah,Cindy CrawfordandVenus Williamswere false after making the allegations during an appearance on a radio station and apologized to the three. All three denied the claims.cite newshttp://espn.go.com/gen/news/2001/0508/1193163.htmlShaq offers apologies for fabricated affairsMay 8, 2001ESPNThe following month, June 2001, Aaliyah posed for a photo shoot with Eric Johnson. Johnson kept the images in his "private personal archive" for thirteen years before providing digital copies of 13 Aaliyah photographs to an online photography magazine and authorizing the publication to use the photographs for a story they were doing on Aaliyah. Not long after, he filed a lawsuit claiming ABC had infringed his rights since the corporation authorized further reproduction by reproducing them online.

Aaliyah released her self-titled album,Aaliyah (album)Aaliyah, in July 2001.It debuted at number two on theBillboard 200''Billboard'' 200, selling 187,000 copies in its first week.cite webhttp://www.billboard.com/articles/news/78998/keys-wards-off-aaliyah-foxy-at-no-1Keys Wards Off Aaliyah, Foxy at No. 1MartensToddJuly 26, 2001BillboardJuly 23, 2009The first single from the album, "We Need a Resolution", peaked at number 59 on theBillboard Hot 100''Billboard'' Hot 100.She finished recording the album in March 2001cite newshttp://www.mtv.com/news/1441665/aaliyah-finishes-new-album-during-break-from-movies/March 14, 2001Aaliyah Finishes New Album During Break From MoviesMTVafter a year of recording tracks that began in March of the previous year. At the time she started recording the album, Aaliyah's publicist disclosed the album's release date as most likely being in October 2000.cite newshttp://www.mtv.com/news/669913/aaliyah-back-in-recording-studio/Aaliyah Back In Recording StudioMarch 9, 2000MTVFilming forQueen of the Damneddelayed the release ofAaliyah. Aaliyah enjoyed balancing her singing and acting careers. Though she called music a "first" for her, she also had been acting since she was young and had wanted to begin acting "at some point in my career," but "wanted it to be the right time and the right vehicle" and feltRomeo Must Die"was it".

Aaliyahwas released five years afterOne in a Million. Aaliyah had not intended for the albums to have such a gap between them. "I wanted to take a break afterOne in a Millionto just relax, think about how I wanted to approach the next album. Then, when I was ready to start back up, "Romeo" happened, and so I had to take another break and do that film and then do the soundtrack, then promote it. The break turned into a longer break than I anticipated."cite newshttp://rapfix.mtv.com/2011/08/25/aaliyah-final-mtv-interview/Remembering Aaliyah Ten Years Later: The Final MTV InterviewRAPFIXAugust 25, 2011Connie Johnson of theLos Angeles Timesargued that Aaliyah having to focus on her film career may have caused her to not give the album "the attention it merited."cite newshttp://articles.latimes.com/2001/jul/29/entertainment/ca-27750A Coasting Aaliyah Steers Clear of DepthJuly 29, 2001Los Angeles TimesConnieJohnsonCollaborator Timbaland concurred, stating that he was briefly in Australia to work on the album while Aaliyah was filming and did not feel the same production had gone intoAaliyahasOne in a Millionhad. He also said Virgin Records had rushed the album and Aaliyah had specifically requested Missy Elliott and Timbaland work onAaliyahwith her.cite newshttps://www.youtube.com/watch?vMissy Elliott & Timbaland talk about Aaliyah (2011)May 22, 2014YouTube

The week after Aaliyah's death, her third studio album,Aaliyah (album)Aaliyah, rose from number 19 to number one on theBillboard 200''Billboard'' 200.cite webhttp://www.billboard.com/articles/news/78474/aaliyah-posthumously-tops-album-chartAaliyah Posthumously Tops Album ChartMartensToddSeptember 6, 2001BillboardJuly 23, 2009"Rock the Boat (Aaliyah song)Rock the Boat" was released as a posthumous single. The music video premiered onBlack Entertainment TelevisionBET'sAccess Granted; it became the most viewed and highest rated episode in the history of the show.cite webhttp://www.complex.com/blogs/2009/08/25/complexs-wifey-hall-of-fame-aaliyah/Complex's Wifey Hall of Fame: AaliyahAugust 25, 2009[[Complex (magazine)|Complex]]Complex Media NetworkAugust 28, 2009The song peaked at number 14 on theBillboard Hot 100''Billboard'' Hot 100and number two on theBillboardHot R&B/Hip-Hop Songschart.cite web{{Allmusic|classAaliyahAllMusicJuly 23, 2009It was also included on theNow That's What I Call Music! 8 (U.S. series)Now That's What I Call Music! 8compilation series; a portion of the album's profits was donated to the Aaliyah Memorial Fund.cite webhttp://www.billboard.com/articles/news/77706/now-8-dedicated-to-aaliyah'NOW! 8' Dedicated to AaliyahJeckellBarry A.November 16, 2001BillboardJuly 23, 2009https://web.archive.org/web/20090802031044/http://www.billboard.com/August 2, 2009noPromotional posters forAaliyahthat had been put up in major cities such as New York and Los Angeles became makeshift memorials for grieving fans.harvnbFarley2002182Farley

"More than a Woman (Aaliyah song)More than a Woman" and "I Care 4 U (song)I Care 4 U" were released as posthumous singles and peaked within the top 25 of theBillboardHot 100.The album was certified doublemusic recording sales certificationPlatinumby theRecording Industry Association of AmericaRIAAand sold 2.95 million copies in the United States.cite webThe Decade in Music: Top 50 Momentshttp://www.billboard.com/articles/news/266327/the-decade-in-music-top-50-moments-page-5BillboardJanuary 7, 2011https://web.archive.org/web/20101211153750/http://www.billboard.com/articles/list/266328/the-decade-in-music-top-50-momentsDecember 11, 2010no"More than a Woman" reached number one on the UK singles chart making Aaliyah the first deceased artist to reach number one on the UK singles chart.cite newshttp://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/entertainment/1758494.stmPosthumous number one for AaliyahBBC NewsJanuary 13, 2001April 7, 2011"More than a Woman" was replaced byGeorge Harrison's "My Sweet Lord" which is the only time in the UK singles chart's history where a dead artist has replaced another dead artist at number one.cite newsGeorge Harrison tops chart againhttp://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/entertainment/1772133.stmBBC NewsMarch 18, 2012January 20, 2002In July 2001, she allowed MTV's showDiary (TV series)Diarybehind-the-scenes access to her life and stated "I am truly blessed to wake up every morning to do something that I love; there is nothing better than that." She continued, "Everything is worth it the hard work, the times when you're tired, the times when you are a bit sad. In the end, it's all worth it because it really makes me happy. I wouldn't trade it for anything else in the world. I've got good friends, a beautiful family and I've got a career. I thank God for his blessings every single chance I get."cite newshttp://www.cnn.com/2011/SHOWBIZ/Music/08/24/aaliyah.10.years.later.laws/Remembering Aaliyah, 10 years laterCNNAngelLawsAugust 24, 2001

Aaliyah was signed to appear in several future films, includingHoney (2003 film)Honey,cite journalJuly 2008Honey (2003)[[Torque (magazine)|Torque]]SPH Magazines1030218-7868https://books.google.com/?idJune 21, 2009a romantic film titledSome Kind of Blue,cite newshttp://www.ew.com/ew/article/0,,172512,00.htmlMusic News – ObituaryBautzMarkAugust 26, 2001Entertainment WeeklyMay 6, 2009https://web.archive.org/web/20090421133830/http://www.ew.com/ew/article/0,,172512,00.htmlApril 21, 2009noand aWhitney Houston-produced remake of the 1976 filmSparkle (1976 film)Sparkle.Whitney Houston recalled Aaliyah being "so enthusiastic" about the film and wanting to appear in the film "so badly". Houston also voiced her belief that Aaliyah was more than qualified for the role and the film was shelved after she died, since Aaliyah had "gone to a better place".cite newshttp://popcrush.com/whitney-houston-aaliyah-sparkle/Whitney Houston Discusses Aaliyah and Upcoming Film 'Sparkle'November 11, 2011PopCrushNadineCheungStudio officials of Warner Brothers stated that Aaliyah and her mother had both read the script forSparkle. According to them, Aaliyah was passionate about playing the lead role of a young singer in a girl group.cite newshttp://articles.latimes.com/2001/sep/24/entertainment/ca-49180Marketing of a Star After DeathLos Angeles TimesSeptember 24, 2001TheSparkle (2012 film)filmwas released in 2012, eleven years after Aaliyah's death. Before her death, Aaliyah had filmed part of her role inThe Matrix Reloadedand was scheduled to appear inThe Matrix RevolutionsasZee (The Matrix)Zee.Aaliyah toldAccess Hollywoodthat she was "beyond happy" to have landed the role.cite newshttp://abcnews.go.com/Entertainment/story?idWhat Happens to Movies After the Star Dies?ABC NewsAugust 29, 2001SharonKnolleThe role was subsequently recast toNona Gaye.Aaliyah's scenes were included in the tribute section of theMatrix Ultimate Collectionseries.Ultimate Matrix Collectiondisc 9: "The Burly Man Chronicles"; Follow the White Rabbit Australia Shoot Tribute.harvnbSutherland2005101none

In November 2001,Ronald Isleystated that Aaliyah and theIsley Brothershad discussed a collaboration prior to her death. She had previously covered the Isley Brothers' single "At Your Best (You Are Love)".cite newshttp://www.highbeam.com/doc/1P1-47886367.htmlAaliyah, Isley Bros. Discussed DuetNovember 1, 2001Associated PressBy 2001, Aaliyah had enjoyed her now seven-year career and felt a sense of accomplishment. "This is what I always wanted," she said of her career inVibemagazine. "I breathe to perform, to entertain, I can't imagine myself doing anything else. I'm just a really happy girl right now. I honestly love every aspect of this business. I really do. I feel very fulfilled and complete."cite newshttp://www.vibe.com/article/aaliyahs-2001-vibe-cover-story-what-lies-beneathAaliyah's 2001 Vibe Cover Story: 'What Lies Beneath'January 14, 2015Vibe.com
article.heading: Artistry
Voice and style
article.paragraph: ListenAaliyah Are You That Somebody sample.ogg"Are You That Somebody?" (1998)[[Timbaland]]'s stuttering, idiosyncratic productions challenged Aaliyah to reveal her artistic personality more than she had on [[R. Kelly]]'s smoother musical settings.<ref name[[Ogg]]rightAaliyah had thevocal rangeof asoprano.With the release of her debut single "Back & Forth (song)Back & Forth", Dimitri Ehrlich ofEntertainment Weeklyexpressed that Aaliyah's "silky vocals are more agile than those of self-proclaimed queen of hip-hop soulMary J. Blige."cite newshttp://www.ew.com/ew/article/0,,302670,00.htmlAge Ain't Nothing but a Number – Music ReviewEhrlichDimitriJune 17, 1994Entertainment WeeklyApril 4, 2009https://web.archive.org/web/20090421095311/http://www.ew.com/ew/article/0,,302670,00.htmlApril 21, 2009noIn her review for Aaliyah's second studio album One in a MillionVibe (magazine)Vibemagazine, music criticDream Hamptonsaid that Aaliyah's "deliciously feline" voice has the same "pop appeal" asJanet Jackson's.https://books.google.com/books?id=4SsEAAAAMBAJ&pg=PA133#v=onepage&q&f=falseAaliyah described her sound as "street but sweet", which featured her "gentle" vocals over a "hard"beat (music)beat.cite newshttp://www.time.com/time/magazine/article/0,9171,168489,00.htmlStreet But SweetFarleyChristopher JohnJuly 22, 2001TimeMay 21, 2009Though Aaliyah did not write any of her own material,her lyrics were described as in-depth.cite webhttp://www.slantmagazine.com/music/review/aaliyah-age-aint-nothing-but-a-number/414Slant Magazine Music Review: Aaliyah: Age Ain't Nothing But A NumberCinquemaniSal2001SlantApril 4, 2009cite webhttp://allmusic.com/album/aaliyah-r539210Aaliyah – AaliyahErlewineStephen ThomasAllMusicJanuary 7, 2011https://web.archive.org/web/20101210075745/http://allmusic.com/album/aaliyah-r539210December 10, 2010noShe incorporatedcontemporary R&BR&B,pop musicpopandhip hop musichip hopinto her music.cite webhttp://www.billboard.com/articles/news/266327/the-decade-in-music-top-50-moments-page-5The Decade in Music: Top 50 Moments page 5BillboardharvnbSutherland2005168noneHer songs were often uptempo and at the same time often dark, revolving around "matters of the heart".cite newshttp://www.ew.com/ew/article/0,,168502~4~~aaliyah,00.htmlAaliyah – Music ReviewSeymourCraigJune 23, 2001Entertainment WeeklyApril 4, 2009After her R. Kelly-produced debut album, Aaliyah worked with Timbaland and Missy Elliott, whose productions were moreelectronic musicelectronic.cite journalNeedhamAlexWho's That Girl?[[NME]]LondonJuly 7, 200125–26Sasha Frere-JonesofThe Wire (magazine)The Wirefinds Aaliyah's "Are You That Somebody?" to be Timbaland's "masterpiece" and exemplary of his production's start-stop rhythms, with "big half-second pauses between beats and voices".cite journalFrere-JonesSashaSasha Frere-JonesDecember 1998Timbaland: These Beats Work[[The Wire (magazine)|The Wire]]178Keith Harris ofRolling Stonecites "Are You That Somebody?" as "one of '90s R&B's most astounding moments".

Aaliyah's songs have been said to have "crisp production" and "staccatoarrangements" that "extend genre boundaries" while containing "old-school"soul music.Kelefah Sanneh ofThe New York Timescalled Aaliyah "a digital diva who wove a spell with ones and zeroes", and writes that her songs comprised "simple vocal riffs, repeated and refracted to echo the manipulated loops that create digital rhythm", as Timbaland's "computer-programmed beats fitted perfectly with her cool, breathy voice to create a new kind of electronic music."cite newsSannehKelefaSeptember 2, 2001http://www.nytimes.com/2001/09/02/arts/a-pioneer-briefly-of-a-new-sound.htmlA Pioneer, Briefly, Of a New Sound[[The New York Times]]December 9, 2012http://www.webcitation.org/6Cm4VhhRGDecember 9, 2012noWhen she experimented with other genres onAaliyah, such asLatin popandheavy metal musicheavy metal,Entertainment Weekly'sCraig Seymourpanned the attempt.While Analyzing her eponymous album British publicationNME(New Musical Express) felt that Aaliyah's radical third album was intended to consolidate her position as U.S.contemporary R&BR&B's most experimental artist.http://www.nme.com/news/aaliyah/8254As her albums progressed, writers felt that Aaliyah matured, calling her progress a "declaration of strength and independence".harvnbFarley20026noneABC Newsnoted that Aaliyah's music was evolving from the punchypop musicpopinfluencedHip hop musicHip hopandContemporary R&BR&Bto a more mature, introspective sound on her third album.http://abcnews.go.com/Entertainment/story?id=101199&page=1Stephen Thomas ErlewineofAllMusicdescribed her eponymous album,Aaliyah (album)Aaliyah, as "a statement of maturity and a stunning artistic leap forward" and called it one of the strongest urban soul records of its time.She portrayed "unfamiliar sounds, styles and emotions", but managed to please critics with the contemporary sound it contained.Ernest Hardy ofRolling Stonefelt that Aaliyah reflected a stronger technique, where she gave her best vocal performance.cite webhttp://www.rollingstone.com/reviews/album/123191/review/6067616/aaliyahAaliyah – Aaliyah – ReviewHardyErnestAugust 2, 2001Rolling StoneOctober 29, 2010https://web.archive.org/web/20071224154411/http://www.rollingstone.com/reviews/album/123191/review/6067616/aaliyahDecember 24, 2007Prior to her death, Aaliyah expressed a desire to learn about the burgeoningUK garagescene she had heard about at the time.
article.heading: Influences and image
article.paragraph: As an artist, Aaliyah often voiced that she was inspired by a number of performers. These includeMichael Jackson,Stevie Wonder,Sade AduSade,En Vogue,Nine Inch Nails,Korn,Prince (musician)Prince,Naughty by Nature,Johnny Mathis,Janet JacksonharvnbSutherland20058–10noneandBarbara Streisand.http://nypost.com/2001/07/15/aaaah-aaliyah-this-22-year-old-rb-singer-has-her-eyes-on-the-prize/Aaliyah expressed that Michael Jackson'sThriller (Michael Jackson album)Thrillerwas her "favorite album" and that "nothing will ever topThriller."She stated that she admired Sade because "she stays true to her style no matter what ... she's an amazing artist, an amazing performer ... and I absolutely love her."Aaliyah expressed she had always desired to work with Janet Jackson, whom she had drawn frequent comparison to over the course of her career, stating "I admire her a great deal. She's a total performer ... I'd love to do a duet with Janet Jackson."Cite newsDrennenEileen M.MurraySoniaHamiltonDougDollarSteveHenryDerrickJanichKathyDeVaultRussHome Entertainment The Latest in Music, Videos And Books New Music Mini Reviews Review[[The Atlanta Journal-Constitution]][[Cox Enterprises]]August 9, 1996G.06Actually, she's a streetwise Jackson with a far more soulful song selection. The gritty beats just don't stop on 'One in a Million,' which, a la Jackson, has one track after another aching for sensual choreography.Cite newsJohnsonConnieAaliyah's Spirit Sounds Like a 'Million'[[Los Angeles Times]]September 28, 199680458-3035Kelly, who produced Aaliyah's 1994 hits 'Back and Forth' and 'At Your Best (You Are Love),' took a girl with admittedly thin vocal chops—but a truckload of poise and precocity—and turned her into the most convincing studio-produced marvel this side of 'Control'-era Janet Jackson.Cite newsWiltzTeresaAaliyah's Peek Performance[[The Washington Post]]July 22, 2001G.020190-8286Aaliyah is a contemporary of those other barely post-adolescent R&B crooners, from Mya to Monica to Brandy et al. But with her edge and attitude—not to mention dance skills—the 21-year-old actually has more in common with Janet Jackson.Jackson reciprocated Aaliyah's affections, commenting "I've loved her from the beginning because she always comes out and does something different, musically." Jackson also stated she would have enjoyed collaborating with Aaliyah.

Aaliyah focused on her public image throughout her career. She often wore baggy clothes and sunglasses, stating that she wanted to be herself.harvnbSutherland200551noneShe described her image as being "important ... to differentiate yourself from the rest of the pack".harvnbSutherland200552noneShe often wore black clothing, starting a trend for similar fashion among women in United States and Japan.harvnbSutherland200553noneAaliyah's fashionable style has been credited for being an influence on new fashion trend's calledHealth Gothhttp://jezebel.com/aaliyah-is-the-alpha-and-omega-of-your-trending-outfit-1658098643http://nymag.com/thecut/2014/11/midriffs-for-days-aaliyahs-iconic-90s-style.htmland "Ghetto Goth" also known as GHE20 GOTH1Khttp://www.thefader.com/2013/11/15/interview-venus-x-rihanna-ghetto-goth-ghe20-gothi1http://style.mtv.com/2013/08/23/style-icon-aaliyah/Aaliyah participated in fashion designerTommy Hilfiger's All America Tour and was featured in Tommy Jean ads, which depicted her inboxer shorts, baggy jeans and atube top. Hilfiger's brother,Andy HilfigerAndy, called it "a whole new look" that was "classy but sexy".When she changed her hairstyle, Aaliyah took her mother's advice to cover her left eye, much likeVeronica Lake.harvnbSutherland200554noneThe look has become known as her signature and been referred to as fusion of "unnerving emotional honesty" and "a sense of mystique".cite newshttp://www.theguardian.com/music/2011/aug/25/aaliyahs-legacyAaliyah's true legacy is her rare gift for nuanceAugust 25, 2011The GuardianAlexMacphersonIn 1998, she hired apersonal trainerto keep in shape, and exercised five days a week and atediet foods.harvnbSutherland200550noneAaliyah was praised for her "clean-cut image" and "moral values".cite newshttp://archives.cnn.com/2001/SHOWBIZ/Music/08/26/death.aaliyah/U.S. investigators to probe Aaliyah crashAugust 27, 2001CNNMay 21, 2009https://web.archive.org/web/20090421105249/http://archives.cnn.com/2001/SHOWBIZ/Music/08/26/death.aaliyah/April 21, 2009noRobert ChristgauofThe Village Voicewrote of Aaliyah's artistry and image, "she was lithe and dulcet in a way that signified neither jailbait nor hottieanIngenue (stock character)ingenuewhose selling point was sincerity, not innocence and the obverse it implies."cite newsChristgauRobertRobert ChristgauMarch 25, 2003http://www.villagevoice.com/2003-03-25/music/as-long-as-i-still-can/As Long as I Still Can[[The Village Voice]]New YorkOctober 7, 2012

Aaliyah was viewed by others as a role model. Emil Wilbekin, described byCNNas "a friend of Aaliyah's" and follower of her career, explained: "Aaliyah is an excellent role model, because she started her career in the public eye at age 15 with a gold album entitledAge Ain't Nothing but a Number. And then her second album,One in a Million (Aaliyah album)One in a Millionwent double platinum. She had the leading role inRomeo Must Die, which was a box office success. She's won numerous awards, several MTV music video awards, and aside from her professional successes, many of her lyrics are very inspirational and uplifting. She also carried herself in a very professional manner. She was well spoken. She was beautiful, but she didn't use her beauty to sell her music. She used her talent. Many young hip-hop fans greatly admire her."cite newshttp://edition.cnn.com/2001/COMMUNITY/08/27/welbekin.cnna/index.htmlVibe Magazine's Emil Wilbekin: Remembering AaliyahAugust 27, 2001CNN

She was seen by yet others as asex symbol. Aaliyah did not have problem with being considered one. "I know that people think I'm sexy and I am looked at as that, and it is cool with me," she stated. "It's wonderful to have sex appeal. If you embrace it, it can be a very beautiful thing. I am totally cool with that. Definitely. I see myself as sexy. If you are comfortable with it, it can be very classy and it can be very appealing."cite newshttps://books.google.com/books?idSultry Singer Aaliyah On Why It's Cool To Be So HotJuly 23, 2001JetThe single "We Need a Resolution" was argued to have transformed "the once tomboy into a sexy grown woman".cite newshttp://boom92houston.com/3918/artist-spotlight-aaliyah/Artist Spotlight: AaliyahJanuary 16, 2015Boom 92Aaliyah mentioned that her mother, during her childhood, would take pictures of her and notice a sex appeal. She reinforced her mother's belief by saying that she did feel "sexy for sure" and that she embraced it and was comfortable with this view of her.
article.heading: Personal life
article.paragraph: In her spare time, she was mostly a home person, which dated back to her younger years, but on occasion went out and playedlaser tag. She reasoned this was due to her liking "the simple things in life".Despite making a profit from her career that allowed her to purchase the vehicle she wanted, Aaliyah revealed during her final interview on August 21, 2001 on106 & Parkthat she had never owned a car due to living in New York City and hiring a car or driver on a regular basis.cite newshttp://www.biography.com/news/aaliyah-facts-lifetime-movie7 Facts About Aaliyah: Get The Scoop Before You Watch the Lifetime Movie[[Biography.com]]SaraBibelNovember 12, 2014
article.heading: Family
article.paragraph: Aaliyah's family played a major role in the course of her career.Aaliyah's father Michael Haughton, who died in 2012, served as her personal manager. Her mother assisted her in her career while brother Rashad Haughton and cousin Jomo Hankerson worked with her consistently.cite newshttp://thegrio.com/2011/12/27/drakes-tattoo-to-timbalands-heart-aaliyah-still-idolized-after-all-these-years/Drake's tattoo to Timbaland's heart: Aaliyah still idolized after all these yearsDecember 27, 2011theGrioRonda RachaPenriceHer father's illness ended his co-management of Aaliyah with her mother Diane Haughton. She ran all of her decisions by Rashad.

Aaliyah was known to have usually been accompanied by members of her immediate family and the "Rock the Boat" filming was credited by Rashad Haughton as being the first and only time her family was not present. In October 2001, Rashad stated: "It really boggles everyone [that] from Day One, every single video she ever shot there's always been myself or my mother or my father there. The circumstances surrounding this last video were really strange because my mother had eye surgery and couldn't fly. That really bothered her because she always traveled. My dad had to take care of my mom at that time. And I went to Australia to visit some friends. We really couldn't understand why we weren't there. You ask yourself maybe we could have stopped it. But you can't really answer the question. There's always gonna be that question of why."Farley, p. 176.Her friendKidada Jonessaid in the last year of her life her parents had given her more freedom and she had talked about wanting a family. "She wanted to have a family, and we talked about how we couldn't wait to kick back with our babies."cite newshttp://www.rollingstone.com/music/news/aaliyah-1979-2001-20011011?pageAaliyah Obituary: Remembering the R&B StarRolling StoneOctober 11, 2001

Gladys Knight, who married her uncleBarry Hankerson, was essential to the start of Aaliyah's career as she gave her many of her earlier performances. One of their last conversations concerned Aaliyah having difficulty with "another young artist" that she was trying to work with. Knight felt the argument was "petty" and insisted that she remain being who she was in spite of the conflict.cite newshttp://www.people.com/people/article/0,,623395,00.htmlAunt Gladys Knight Remembers AaliyahJanuary 16, 2002[[People.com]]Stephen M.Silverman
article.heading: Illegal marriage
article.paragraph: With the release ofAge Ain't Nothing but a Number, rumors circulated of a relationship between Aaliyah andR. Kelly.harvnbKenyatta200225noneShortly after, there was speculation about a secret marriage with the release of "Age Ain't Nothing but a Number" and the adult content that Kelly had written for Aaliyah.cite webhttp://www.vibe.com/news/online_exclusives/2008/09/rkelly_day_part3/R. Kelly: Indecent ProposalSeptember 18, 2008[[Vibe (magazine)|Vibe]]May 14, 2009yeshttps://web.archive.org/20081201115820/http://www.vibe.com/news/online_exclusives/2008/09/rkelly_day_part3/1 December 2008Vibe (magazine)Vibemagazine later revealed a marriage certificate that listed the couple married on August 31, 1994, in Sheraton Gateway Suites inRosemont, Illinois.Aaliyah, who was 15 at the time, was listed as 18 on the certificate; the illegal marriage was annulled in February 1995 by her parents.cite webhttp://abcnews.go.com/Entertainment/Story?idGone Before 30: Stars Who Died YoungAneesSairaKramer, CarolynJanuary 29, 2008[[ABC News]]September 14, 2009The pair continued to deny marriage allegations, stating that neither was married.One particular allegation among the rumor was that Aaliyah wedded R. Kelly without her parents' knowledge.cite newshttp://www.highbeam.com/doc/1P1-2349254.htmlAaliyah: Weathering the storm of controversyJuly 8, 1995Indianapolis RecorderShondaMcClain

Aaliyah reportedly developed a friendship with R. Kelly during the recording of her debut album. As she recalled toVibemagazine in 1994, she and R. Kelly would "go watch a movie" and "go eat" when she got tired and would then "come back and work". She described the relationship between her and R. Kelly as being "rather close."cite newshttp://b96.cbslocal.com/2011/08/31/r-kelly-and-aaliyah-secretly-married-on-this-day-in-1994/R. Kelly And Aaliyah Secretly Married On This Day In 1994August 31, 2011Chicago's B96In December 1994, Aaliyah told theSun-Timesthat whenever she was asked about being married to R. Kelly, she urged them not to believe "all that mess" and that she and R. Kelly were "close" and "people took it the wrong way."cite newshttp://www.wbez.org/blogs/jim-derogatis/2013-07/timeline-life-and-career-r-kelly-107973Timeline: The life and career of R. Kelly[[WBEZ 91.5 Chicago]]In his 2011 bookThe Man Behind the Man: Looking From the Inside Out, Demetrius Smith Sr., a former member of R. Kelly's entourage, wrote that R. Kelly told him "in a voice that sounded as if he wanted to burst into tears" that he thought Aaliyah was pregnant.cite newshttp://s2smagazine.com/2011/05/25/did-rkelly-impregnate-aaliyah/Did R. Kelly impregnate Aaliyah?May 25, 2011[[S2SMagazine.com]]

Jamie Foster Brownin the 1994 issue ofSister 2 Sisterwrote that "R. Kelly told me that he and Aaliyah got together and it was just magic." Brown also reported hearing about a relationship between them. "I've been hearing about Robert and Aaliyah for a whilethat she was pregnant. Or that she was coming and going in and out of his house. People would see her walking his dog, 12 Play, with her basketball cap and sunglasses on. Every time I asked the label, they said it was platonic. But I kept hearing complaints from people about her being in the studio with all those men. At 15," Brown said. "you have all those hormones and no brains attached to them."cite newshttps://books.google.com/books?id[[Vibe (magazine)|Vibe]]December 1994R. Kelly marriage to Aaliyah

Aaliyah admitted in court documents that she had lied about her age. In May 1997, she filed suit in Cook County seeking to have all records of the marriage expunged because she was not old enough under state law to get married without her parents' consent. It was reported that she cut off all professional and personal ties with R. Kelly after the marriage was annulled and ceased having contact with him.cite newshttp://www.suntimes.com/news/metro/kelly/939951,kellya.articleKelly accused of sex with teenage girlsDecember 21, 2000[[Chicago Sun-Times]]yeshttps://web.archive.org/20080516005806/http://www.suntimes.com:80/news/metro/kelly/939951,kellya.article16 May 2008In 2014, Jomo Hankerson stated that Aaliyah "got villainized" over her relationship with R. Kelly and the scandal over the marriage made it difficult to find producers for her second album. "We were coming off of a multi-platinum debut album and except for a couple of relationships with Jermaine Dupri and Puffy, it was hard for us to get producers on the album." Hankerson also expressed confusion over why "they were upset" with Aaliyah given her age at the time.cite newshttp://madamenoire.com/441983/aaliyahs-cousin-says-villainized-r-kelly-marriage-scandal-dont-understand-upset-baby-girl/Aaliyah's Cousin Says She Was 'Villainized' Over R. Kelly Marriage ScandalMadameNoireJune 25, 2014Jazmine DeniseRogers

Aaliyah was known to avoid answering questions regarding R. Kelly following the professional split. During an interview with Christopher John Farley, she was asked if she was still in contact with him and if she would ever work with him again. Farley said Aaliyah responded with a "firm, frosty" 'No' to both of the questions.Farley 2002, p. 162.Vibemagazine said Aaliyah changed the subject anytime "you bring up the marriage with her".A spokeswoman for Aaliyah told theChicago Sun-Timesin 2000 that when "R. Kelly comes up, she doesn't even speak his name, and nobody's allowed to ask about it at all".cite newshttp://www.thedailybeast.com/articles/2013/12/09/why-has-the-public-forgiven-r-kelly-for-his-sordid-predatory-past.htmlWhy Has the Public Forgiven R. Kelly for His Sordid, Predatory Past?December 9, 2013[[The Daily Beast]]

R. Kelly would have other allegations made about him regarding underage girls in the years following her death and his marriage to Aaliyah was used to evidence his involvement with them. He refused to discuss his relationship with her, citing that she was dead. "Out of respect for her, and her mom and her dad, I will not discuss Aaliyah. That was a whole other situation, a whole other time, it was a whole other thing, and I'm sure that people also know that."cite newshttp://www.mtv.com/bands/r/r_kelly/news_feature_051304/index4.jhtmlR. Kelly: When The Gavel DropsMTV NewsMay 13, 2004JenniferVineyardAaliyah's mother Diane Haughton reflected that everything "that went wrong in her life" began with her relationship with R. Kelly.The allegations have been said to have done "little to taint Aaliyah's image or prevent her from becoming a reliable '90s hitmaker with viable sidelines in movies and modeling."cite newshttp://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/the-juice/6099210/aaliyah-age-aint-nothing-but-a-number-at-20-classic-track-byAaliyah, 'Age Ain't Nothing But A Number' at 20: Classic Track-by-Track ReviewMay 23, 2014[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]KennethPartridge
article.heading: Relationships
article.paragraph: multiple imageright Aaliyah had good relationships with her collaborators [[Timbaland]] and [[Missy Elliott]]. (left to right) Timbaland1292010.png 120 MissyElliott_2010flickr.jpg 127 Quincy Jonessaid she was "like one of my daughters" and Aaliyah vacationed with him and his family in Fiji.cite newshttp://www.hollywood.com/news/brief/770657/singer-aaliyah-dies-in-plane-crashSinger Aaliyah dies in plane crashAugust 27, 2001KitBowenHollywood.comShe was close friends with his daughterKidada Jones. By 2001, they had been best friends for five years and Jones described her as having a great sense of humor. Aaliyah and Jones would make prank phone calls to what Aaliyah referred to as "public establishments".At the time of her death, she and Jones were planning on starting a clothing line, benefited by Aaliyah's popularity as a "style-setter" and she sought to capitalize on her good taste.Farley 2002, p. 93.Her brother Rashad called her his best friend and stated that she "was my everything".

Beyoncstated after Aaliyah's death that she was "the very first person to embrace Destiny's Child."cite newshttp://abcnews.go.com/Entertainment/story?idMore Questions Emerge in Aaliyah CrashABC NewsAugust 29, 2001Aaliyah met Beyonc as well as the other members of Destiny's Child around 1998 in Los Angeles. They were intimidated about meeting her, since she had already established herself and they were just making their names at the time. Beyonc observed Aaliyah as having "handled herself like a lady" and commented on the "aura" she had, which she believed was an indication of Aaliyah having "a great family."Farley, pp. 141142.

In addition to working with them, Aaliyah had friendships withMissy ElliottandTimbaland. Aaliyah recalled her first time meeting Missy Elliott. "When we met, there was a bond that was established real quickly. A friendship formed and we built our studio relationship from that."Farley 2002, p. 70.Missy Elliott said in 2010 that "there's not a day that goes by that I don't think" of Aaliyah and that she misses her every day.cite newshttp://www.mtv.com/news/1646426/missy-elliott-remembers-aaliyah-nine-years-later/Missy Elliott remembers Aaliyah, Nine Years LaterMTVMissy Elliott said of Aaliyah during an appearance on RapFix Live in November 2012, "Aaliyah, she was like a comedian. She always wanted to laugh."cite newshttp://www.mtv.com/news/1694185/missy-elliott-aaliyah-rapfix-live/Missy Elliot Remembers AaliyahMTVNovember 20, 2012

Timbaland admitted in 2011 that he was in love with her, but did not act out on his feelings due to their age difference and determined he would just "be her brother". Despite this declaration, he still struggled with keeping his feelings to himself.cite newshttp://www.eonline.com/news/281124/timbaland-spills-secret-about-aaliyah-i-was-in-love-with-herTimbaland Spills Secret About Aaliyah: "I Was in Love With Her"December 16, 2011BrunaNessifTimbaland said the pair had an argument before her death and he learned of her passing when attempting to reconcile.Immediately following her death, Timbaland told MTV he considered her as his "little sister" and that he and Aaliyah had a "chemistry" and that he had lost half of his creativity with her death. He also said that fans needed to know that beyond music "she was a brilliant person."cite newshttp://www.nydailynews.com/archives/news/beau-pals-filled-heartache-article-1.919962BEAU, PALS FILLED WITH HEARTACHEDaily NewsNew YorkAugust 28, 2001Aaliyah's death had a large impact on both of them as they had been her closest collaborators in the last five years of her career and they owed their initial success to her.cite bookThird Coast: Outkast, Timbaland, and How Hip-Hop Became a Southern ThingRoniSarig162.2007Da Capo Press978-0-306-81430-3

In 2015, Damon Dash claimed thatJay Ztried to date Aaliyah, but she placed him in the "friend zone".cite newshttp://hiphopdx.com/news/id.35948/title.jay-z-was-interested-in-aaliyah-dame-dash-saysJay Z Was Interested In Aaliyah, Dame Dash SaysDanielleHarlingOctober 20, 2015HipHopDX
article.heading: Engagement
article.paragraph: Aaliyah was dating co-founder ofRoc-A-Fella RecordsDamon Dashat the time of her death and, though they were not formally engaged, in interviews given after Aaliyah's death Dash claimed the couple had planned to marry.cite webCallowaySwayDamon Dash Says Every Day with Aaliyah Was Specialhttp://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1448466/boyfriend-damon-dash-recalls-aaliyah.jhtml[[MTV News]]August 5, 2014Hiatt, Brian; Kroft, RyanAugust 28, 2001Aaliyah and Dash met through his accountant and formed a friendship.cite newshttp://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/the-juice/467784/damon-dash-talks-losing-aaliyah-nothing-prepares-you-for-thatDamon Dash Talks Losing Aaliyah: 'Nothing Prepares You for That'August 24, 2011BillboardErikaRamirezDash has said he is unsure of how he and Aaliyah started dating and that the two just understood each other. "I don't know [how we got involved], just spending time, you know, we just saw things the same and it was new, you know what I mean? Meeting someone that is trying to do the same thing you are doing in the urban market, in the same urban market place but not really being so urban. It was just; her mind was where my mind was. She understood me and she got my jokes. She thought my jokes were funny."cite newshttp://madamenoire.com/271736/i-felt-my-worst-pain-damon-dash-talks-losing-aaliyah/#sthash.0ItgZlrh.dpuf'I Felt My Worst Pain:' Damon Dash Opens Up About Losing AaliyahApril 11, 2013MadameNoireJazmine DeniseRogers

Dash expressed his belief that Aaliyah was the "one" and claimed the pair were not officially engaged, but had spoken about getting married prior to her death.Farley 2002, p. 140.Aaliyah publicly never addressed the relationship between her and Dash as being anything but platonic. In May 2001, she hosted a party for Dash's 30th birthday at a New York City club, where they were spotted together and Dash was seen escorting her to a bathroom. Addressing this, Aaliyah stated that she and Dash were just "very good friends" and chose to "keep it at that" for the time being.cite newshttps://books.google.com/books?idVibe interview in August 2001VibeAugust 2001Just two weeks before her death, Aaliyah traveled from New Jersey to East Hampton, New York to visit Dash at the summer house he shared withJay-Z.

The couple were separated for long periods at a time, as Dash recalled that Aaliyah continuously shot films and would be gone for months often to come back shortly and continue her schedule. Dash was also committed to "his own thing", which did not make matters any better. Despite this, they were understanding that the time they had together was special. Dash remembered they would "be in a room full of people talking to each other and it felt like everyone was listening but it would be just us. It would be like we were the only ones in the room". Dash always felt their time together was essential and Aaliyah was the person he was interested in being with, which is why, as he claimed, they had begun speaking about engagement.The relationship was mentioned in the lyrics of Jay-Z's remix to her song "Miss You (Aaliyah song)Miss You", released after her death.
article.heading: Death
article.paragraph: MainDeath of AaliyahOn August 25, 2001, at 6:50 p.m. (Eastern Time ZoneEDT), Aaliyah and the members of the record company boarded a twin-engineCessna 402Cessna 402B(Aircraft registrationregistrationN8097W) at theMarsh Harbour AirportinAbaco Islands, The Bahamas, to travel to theOpa-locka Airportin Florida, after they completed filming the music video for "Rock the Boat (Aaliyah song)Rock the Boat".cite webhttp://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1448402/20010826/aaliyah.jhtmlAaliyah Killed in Plane CrashSchumacher-RasmussenEricAugust 26, 2001MTV NewsApril 9, 2009https://web.archive.org/web/20090418020928/http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1448402/20010826/aaliyah.jhtml?April 18, 2009noThey had a flight scheduled the following day, but with filming finishing early, Aaliyah and her entourage were eager to return to the United States and made the decision to leave immediately. The designated airplane was smaller than theCessna 404 TitanCessna 404on which they had originally arrived, but the whole party and all of the equipment were accommodated on board.harvnbSutherland2005119noneThe plane crashed shortly after takeoff, aboutconvert200ftm-1from the end of the runway and exploded.

Aaliyah and the eight others on boardpilot Luis Morales III, hair stylist Eric Forman, Anthony Dodd, security guard Scott Gallin, family friend Keith Wallace, make-up stylist Christopher Maldonado, andBlackground Recordsemployees Douglas Kratz and Gina Smithwere all killed.cite newshttp://archives.cnn.com/2001/SHOWBIZ/Music/08/26/death.aaliyah/U.S. investigators to probe Aaliyah crashAugust 27, 2001CNNApril 8, 2009https://web.archive.org/web/20090413035550/http://archives.cnn.com/2001/SHOWBIZ/Music/08/26/death.aaliyah/April 13, 2009noGallin survived the initial impact and spent his last moments worrying about Aaliyah's condition, according to ambulance drivers.Farley, pp. 169170.The plane was identified as being owned by Florida-based company Skystream by Kathleen Bergen, spokeswoman for the USFederal Aviation Administration(FAA) in Atlanta. Initial reports of the crash identified Luis Morales as "L Marael".cite newshttp://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/americas/1510034.stmR&B's Aaliyah dies in plane crashAugust 26, 2001BBC News

According to findings from an inquest conducted by the coroner's office in The Bahamas, Aaliyah suffered from "severe burns and a blow to the head", in addition to severe shock and a weak heart.cite webhttp://www.nme.com/news/aaliyah/15575Coroner Delivers Verdict Over Aaliyah Death CrashNovember 20, 2003NMEMarch 5, 2010The coroner theorized that she went into such a state of shock that even if she had survived the crash, her recovery would have been nearly impossible.cite webhttp://www.caribbeannetnews.com/2003/11/21/aaliyah.htmBahamas Coroner delivers verdict in Aaliyah death crashNovember 21, 2003Caribbean NewsCaribbean Net NewsFebruary 7, 2007https://web.archive.org/web/20040127093955/http://www.caribbeannetnews.com/2003/11/21/aaliyah.htmJanuary 27, 2004The bodies were taken to the morgue atPrincess Margaret Hospital (Nassau)Princess Margaret Hospitalin Nassau, where they were kept for relatives to help identify them. Some of the bodies were badly burned in the crash.cite newshttp://articles.sun-sentinel.com/2001-08-27/entertainment/sfl-ent-aaliyah-remembered-082511_1_plane-crash-cessna-402b-rock-da-boatSinger Aaliyah dies in Bahamas plane crashAugust 27, 2001BillHirschmanSun Sentinel

As the subsequent investigation determined, when the aircraft attempted to depart, it was over its maximum take-off weight byconvert700lbkg-1and was carrying one excess passenger, according to its certification.cite webhttp://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1456119/20020716/aaliyah.jhtmlCocaine, Alcohol Found in Pilot of Aaliyah's PlaneMossCoreyJuly 16, 2002MTV NewsJune 17, 2009https://web.archive.org/web/20090623072850/http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1456119/20020716/aaliyah.jhtmlJune 23, 2009noTheNational Transportation Safety Boardreport stated that "the airplane was seen lifting off the runway, and then nose down, impacting in a marsh on the south side of the departure end of runway 27 and then exploding in flames."cite techreporthttp://www.ntsb.gov/aviationquery/brief2.aspx?ev_idNTSB Identification: MIA01RA225[[National Transportation Safety Board]]June 11, 2009It indicated that the pilot was not approved to fly the plane. Morales falsely obtained his FAA license by showing hundreds of hours never flown, and he may also have falsified how many hours he had flown in order to get a job with his employer,Blackhawk International Airways.harvnbSimmonds2008455noneAdditionally, anautopsyperformed on Morales revealed traces ofcocaineandalcoholin his system.cite newshttp://www.cbsnews.com/stories/2003/11/19/entertainment/main584494.shtmlAaliyah Crash Pilot Was on CocaineHolguínJaimeNovember 11, 2003[[CBS News]]April 7, 2009

Aaliyah's funeral was held on August 31, 2001, at theChurch of St. Ignatius Loyola (New York City)St. Ignatius Loyola ChurchinManhattan. Her body was set in a silver-plated copper-depositcoffincasket, which was carried in a glass horse-drawnhearse.cite newshttp://www.cbsnews.com/stories/2001/08/26/entertainment/main308179.shtmlHundreds Say Good-Bye to AaliyahCBS NewsFebruary 2, 2010August 26, 2001https://web.archive.org/web/20100119084456/http://www.cbsnews.com/stories/2001/08/26/entertainment/main308179.shtmlJanuary 19, 2010noAn estimated 800 mourners were in attendance at the procession.cite newshttp://www.cbsnews.com/stories/2001/08/26/entertainment/main308179.shtmlHundreds Say Good-Bye To AaliyahMilianoLouAugust 31, 2001CBS NewsApril 24, 2009Among those in attendance at the private ceremony wereMissy Elliott,Timbaland,Gladys Knight,Lil' KimandSean Combs.cite webLopezMollyJanuary 25, 2008Frank E. Campbell's Service to the Starshttp://www.people.com/people/article/0,,20173693,00.htmlPeopleAugust 8, 2010cite newsIn Pictures: Adieu to Aaliyahhttp://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/entertainment/1519692.stmBBC NewsAugust 8, 2010August 31, 2001After the service, 22 white doves were released to symbolize each year of Aaliyah's life.cite webhttp://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1448581/20010831/aaliyah.jhtmlFans, Artists Pay Last Respects To AaliyahReidShaheemAugust 31, 2001MTV NewsJune 17, 2009https://web.archive.org/web/20090601235237/http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1448581/20010831/aaliyah.jhtmlJune 1, 2009noAaliyah was interred in a private room at the end of a corridor in the Rosewood Mausoleum at theFerncliff CemeteryinHartsdale, New York.cite webhttp://www.people.com/people/article/0,,622609,00.htmlFriday: Funeral, Memorial for AaliyahSilvermanStephen M.August 31, 2001TimeJuly 2, 2009The inscription at the bottom of Aaliyah's portrait at the funeral read: "We Were Given a Queen, We Were Given an Angel."cite newshttp://www.mtv.com/news/1448581/fans-artists-pay-last-respects-to-aaliyah/Fans, Artists Pay Last Respects To AaliyahMTVAugust 31, 2001

Aaliyah had thoughts a month before her death that something bad was about to happen to her. "Someone's following me and I don't know why. I'm scared. Then suddenly I lift off. Far away. As if I'm swimming in the air. Nobody can reach me. Nobody can touch me".cite webhttp://uk.eonline.com/news/42093/aaliyah-funeral-set-pilot-probedAaliyah Funeral Set; Pilot Probed[[E!]]Marcus ErricoAugust 29, 2001January 6, 2015It is posited that this was a premonition in Aaliyah's dreams of what was about to happen.New Woman, January 2005, p 66.
article.heading: Posthumous career
article.paragraph: Immediately after Aaliyah's death, there was uncertainty over whether the music video for "Rock the Boat" would ever air.cite newshttp://www.mtv.com/news/1448422/timbaland-p-diddy-other-artists-react-to-aaliyahs-death/Timbaland, P. Diddy, Other Artists React To Aaliyah's DeathAugust 27, 2001MTVEricSchumacher-RasumeenIt made its world premire onBlack Entertainment TelevisionBET'sAccess Grantedon October 9, 2001. She won two posthumous awards at theAmerican Music Awards of 2002; Favorite Female R&B Artist and Favorite R&B/Soul Album forAaliyah.cite webhttp://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1451722/20020110/keys_alicia.jhtmlAlicia Keys, Destiny's Child, Aaliyah Excel at AMAsD'AngeloJoeJanuary 10, 2002MTV NewsApril 9, 2009Her second and final film,Queen of the Damned (film)Queen of the Damned, was released in February 2002. Before its release, Aaliyah's brother, Rashad,dubbing (filmmaking)re-dubbedsome of her lines during post-production.cite webhttp://www.people.com/people/article/0,,623745,00.htmlNona Gaye to Fill in for AaliyahSilvermanStephen M.April 11, 2002PeopleMay 16, 2009https://web.archive.org/web/20090603010411/http://www.people.com/people/article/0,,623745,00.htmlJune 3, 2009nocite newshttp://www.ew.com/ew/article/0,,201771,00.htmlMovie Preview – Queen of the DamnedFebruary 8, 2002Entertainment WeeklyMay 16, 2009It grossed US$15.2 million in its first weekend, ranking number one at the box office.cite newshttp://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/entertainment/1839630.stmAaliyah film tops US box officeFebruary 25, 2002BBC NewsMay 16, 2009LondonOn the first anniversary of Aaliyah's death, a candlelight vigil was held inTimes Square; millions of fans observed amoment of silence; and throughout the United States, radio stations played her music in remembrance.cite journalSeptember 9, 2002Young Legends Who Live on Through Their MusicJet590021-5996https://books.google.com/?idAugust 8, 2010In December 2002, a collection of previously unreleased material was released as Aaliyah's first posthumous album,I Care 4 U. A portion of the proceeds was donated to the Aaliyah Memorial Fund, a program that benefits the Revlon UCLA Women's Cancer Research Program and Harlem's Sloan Kettering Cancer Center.cite webhttp://www.billboard.com/articles/news/73679/unreleased-aaliyah-track-hits-the-netUnreleased Aaliyah Track Hits The NetCohenJonathanOctober 28, 2002BillboardApril 24, 2009https://web.archive.org/web/20090421224041/http://www.billboard.com/April 21, 2009noIt debuted at number three on theBillboard 200''Billboard'' 200, selling 280,000 copies in its first week.cite webhttp://www.billboard.com/articles/news/73092/holiday-sales-keep-shania-up-on-topHoliday Sales Keep Shania 'Up' On TopMartensToddDecember 18, 2002BillboardJuly 23, 2009The album's lead single, "Miss You (Aaliyah song)Miss You", peaked at number three on theBillboard Hot 100''Billboard'' Hot 100and topped theHot R&B/Hip-Hop Songschart.In August of the following year, clothing retailerChristian Dior SAChristian Diordonated profits from sales in honor of Aaliyah.cite webhttp://www.vogue.co.uk/news/daily/2003-08/030805-aaliyah-honoured-by-dior.aspx?DisplayCommentsAaliyah Honoured By DiorAugust 5, 2003[[Vogue (magazine)|Vogue]]April 24, 2009

In 2005, Aaliyah's second compilation album,Ultimate Aaliyahwas released in the UK by Blackground Records.cite web{{Allmusic|classUltimate Aaliyah OverviewKellmanAndy2005AllMusicJune 23, 2009Ultimate Aaliyahis a three disc set, which included a greatest hits audio CD and a DVD.Andy Kellman ofAllMusicremarked "Ultimate Aaliyahadequately represents the shortened career of a tremendous talent who benefited from some of the best songwriting and production work by Timbaland, Missy Elliott, and R. Kelly."A documentary movieAaliyah Live in Amsterdamwas released in 2011, shortly before the tenth anniversary of Aaliyah's death. The documentary, byPogus Caesar, contained previously unseen footage shot of her career beginnings in 1995 when she was appearing in the Netherlands.cite webhttp://www.birminghampost.co.uk/whats-on/film-tv/pogus-caesar-premieres-aaliyah-movie-3919688YoungGrahamPogus Caesar premieres his Aaliyah movie in Birmingham[[Birmingham Post]]July 22, 2011

In March 2012, music producer Jeffrey "J-Dub" Walker announced on his Twitter account that a song "Steady Ground", which he produced for Aaliyah's third album, would be included in the forthcoming posthumous Aaliyah album. This second proposed posthumous album would feature this song using demo vocals, as Walker claims the originals were somehow lost by his sound engineer. Aaliyah's brother Rashad later refuted Walker's claim, claiming that "no official album [is] being released and supported by the Haughton family."cite newsPosthumous Aaliyah Album in the Works: Reporthttp://www.huffingtonpost.com/2012/03/07/posthumous-aaliyah-album_n_1327628.html[[The Huffington Post]][[AOL]]March 18, 2012March 7, 2012BrennanWilliamsOn August 5, 2012, a song entitled "Enough Said (song)Enough Said" was released online. The song was produced by Noah "40" Shebib and features Canadian rapperDrake (entertainer)Drake.cite webRamirezErikaAaliyah Featuring Drake, 'Enough Said': Listenhttp://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/the-juice/480600/aaliyah-featuring-drake-enough-said-listenBillboardAugust 10, 2012August 5, 2012Four days later, Jomo Hankerson confirmed a posthumous album is being produced and that it is scheduled to be released by the end of 2012 byBlackground Records.The album was reported to include 16 unreleased songs and have contributions from Aaliyah's longtime collaboratorsTimbalandandMissy Elliott, among others.cite webHorowitzSteven J.Exclusive: Drake, Missy, Timbaland? Blackground Clarifies Rumors Swirling Around Aaliyah Album (Update)http://www.billboard.biz/bbbiz/industry/record-labels/drake-missy-timbaland-blackground-records-1007791552.storyBillboardAugust 10, 2012August 9, 2012On August 13, Timbaland and Missy Elliott dismissed rumors about being contacted or participating for the project.Elliott's manager Mona Scott-Young said in a statement toXXL (magazine)XXL, "Although Missy and Timbaland always strive to keep the memory of their close friend alive, we have not been contacted about the project nor are there any plans at this time to participate. We've seen the reports surfacing that they have been confirmed to participate but that is not the case. Both Missy and Timbaland are very sensitive to the loss still being felt by the family so we wanted to clear up any misinformation being circulated."Elliott herself said, "Tim and I carry Aaliyah with us everyday, like so many of the people who love her. She will always live in our hearts. We have nothing but love and respect for her memory and for her loved ones left behind still grieving her loss. They are always in our prayers."cite webTimbaland & Missy Elliott Will Not Work on Aaliyah Posthumous Albumhttp://www.xxlmag.com/news/2012/08/timbaland-missy-elliott-will-not-work-on-aaliyah-posthumous-album/XXL NewsSeptember 2, 2012

In June 2013, Aaliyah was featured on a new track byChris Brown (American entertainer)Chris Brown, titled "Don't Think They Know"; with Aaliyah singing the song's hook. The video features dancing holographic versions of Aaliyah. The song appears on Brown's sixth studio album,X (Chris Brown album)X.cite webhttp://www.rollingstone.com/music/videos/chris-brown-pairs-with-aaliyah-hologram-in-new-clip-20130617Chris Brown Pairs With Aaliyah Hologram in 'Don't Think They Know' Video – VideoRolling Stone2013-06-172013-12-05Timbaland voiced his disapproval for "Enough Said" and "Don't Think They Know" in July 2013. He exclaimed, "Aaliyah music only work with its soulmate, which is me".cite newshttp://rapfix.mtv.com/2013/07/24/timbaland-doesnt-approve-of-aaliyah-vocals-on-drake-chris-brown-songs/Timbaland Doesn't Approve Of Aaliyah Vocals On Drake, Chris Brown SongsJuly 24, 2013RAPFIXSoon after, Timbaland apologized to Chris Brown over his remarks, which he explained were made due to Aaliyah and her death being a "very sensitive subject".cite newshttp://rapfix.mtv.com/2013/07/26/timbaland-apologizes-to-chris-brown-for-aaliyah-collab-remarks/Timbaland Apologizes To Chris Brown For Aaliyah Collab RemarksJuly 26, 2013RAPFIXIn January 2014, producer Noah "40" Shebib confirmed that the posthumous album was shelved due to the negative reception surrounding Drake's involvement. Shebib added, "Aaliyah's mother saying, 'I don't want this out' was enough for me ... I walked away very quickly."cite webAaliyah tribute album shelvedhttp://music.msn.com/music/article.aspx?news[[MSN|MSN Music News]]MSN8 January 20148 January 2014cite webAaliyah – Aaliyah Tribute Album Shelvedhttp://www.contactmusic.com/story/aaliyah-tribute-album-shelved_4013686[[Contactmusic.com]]8 January 20148 January 2014

Aaliyah's vocals were reported to be featured on theT-Painmixtape,The Iron Way, on the track "Girlfriend", but were pulled after being met with criticism by fans and many in attendance at a New York listening session that he hosted for the project. In response to the criticism, T-Pain questioned if Aaliyah's legacy was driven by her death and claimed that were she still alive, she would be seen as trying to emulateBeyonc.cite newshttp://allhiphop.com/2015/03/30/t-pain-aaliyah-when-someone-dies-people-act-they-were-the-greatest-the-iron-way-girlfriend/T-Pain On Criticism For Using Aaliyah's Vocals: When Someone Dies People Act Like They Were The Greatest (VIDEO)March 30, 2015AllHipHopAccording to T-Pain, he was given her vocals from a session she had done prior to her death after being approached to work on a track for a posthumous Aaliyah album and completing the song, calling the exchange "just like a swap."cite newshttp://www.vibe.com/2015/03/t-pain-says-aaliyah-overhyped-because-death/T-Pain Speaks On Aaliyah's Overly Exclusive LegacyVibeStacy-AnnEllisMarch 30, 2015

She was featured on theTink (musician)Tinktrack "Million", which was released in May 2015 and contained samples from her song "One in a Million".cite newshttp://www.bet.com/news/music/2015/05/08/tink-samples-aaliyahs-one-in-a-million.htmlTink Samples Aaliyah's 'One in a Million'May 5, 2015BETGeorgeChapman Jr.Collaborator Timbaland was involved in the song's creation, having previously claimed that Aaliyah appeared to him in a dream and stressed that Tink was "the one".cite newshttp://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/the-juice/6561106/tink-timbaland-aaliyah-one-in-a-millionTink & Timbaland Cover Aaliyah's 'One in a Million'May 8, 2015TrevorAndersonBillboard

In August 2015, Timbaland confirmed that he had unreleased vocals from Aaliyah and stated a "sneak peek" would be coming soon.cite newshttp://hiphopdx.com/news/id.35008/title.timbaland-teases-new-aaliyah-musicTimbaland Teases New Aaliyah MusicMitchellSteinfeldHipHopDXcite newshttp://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/the-juice/6656766/timbaland-promises-new-music-from-aaliyahTimbaland Promises New Music From AaliyahMitchellPetersAugust 9, 2015

In September 2015,Aaliyah byXyrena, an official tribute fragrance was announced.cite webTardioAndresHere's The Story Behind The New Aaliyah Fragrancehttp://www.mtv.com/news/2272050/aaliyah-fragrance/MTV NewsViacom International Inc.28 September 2015
article.heading: Legacy
article.paragraph: Aaliyah has been credited for helping redefinecontemporary R&BR&B,pop musicpopandhip hop musichip hopin the 1990s, "leaving an indelible imprint on the music industry as a whole."cite webhttp://www.slantmagazine.com/music/features/aaliyah.aspAaliyah (1979–2001)CinquemaniSalGonzalez, EdSlantMay 10, 2009According toBillboard (magazine)BillboardAaliyah revolutionizedContemporary R&BR&Bwith her sultry mix ofpop musicpop,soul musicsoulandhip hop musichip hop.http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/266327/the-decade-in-music-top-50-moments-page-5In a 2001 review of her eponymous albumRolling Stonemagazine professed that Aaliyah's impact onContemporary R&BR&Bandpop musicpophas been enormous.https://web.archive.org/web/20020606031046/http://www.rollingstone.com/recordings/review.asp?aid=2042779&cf=1967Steve Huey of AllMusic wrote Aaliyah ranks among the "elite" artists of the R&B genre, as she "played a major role in popularizing the stuttering, futuristic production style that consumed hip-hop and urban soul in the late 1990s."cite web{{Allmusic|classAaliyah: BiographyHueySteve2009AllMusicJune 22, 2009Bruce Britt of "music world" onBroadcast Music, Inc's.website stated that by combining "schoolgirl charm with urban grit", Aaliyah helped define the teen-oriented sound that has resulted in contemporarypop musicpopphenom's like Brandy, Christina Aguilera and Destiny's Child.http://www.bmi.com/news/entry/20000701aaliyahDescribed as one of "R&B's most important artists" during the 1990s,cite web{{Allmusic|classI Care 4 U – OverviewBushJohnAllMusicJuly 1, 2009her second studio album,One in a Million (Aaliyah album)One in a Million, became one of the most influential R&B albums of the decade.cite webhttp://www.slantmagazine.com/music/review/aaliyah-one-in-a-million/415Aaliyah: One in a MillionCinquemaniSal2001[[Slant Magazine|Slant]]January 3, 2010Music criticSimon Reynoldscited "Are You That Somebody?" as "the most radical pop single" of 1998. Kelefah Sanneh ofThe New York Timeswrote that rather than being the song's focal point, Aaliyah "knew how to disappear into the music, how to match her voice to the bass line", and consequently "helped change the way popular music sounds; the twitchy, beat-driven songs ofDestiny's Childowe a clear debt to 'Are You That Somebody'."
